title: Report: ‘Hackett arrested on Gold Coast’
text:
Former Olympic Games champion Grant Hackett arrested, according to TV news report February 15, 2017 2:47pm by Staff Writers Source: FOX SPORTS FORMER Olympic swimmer Grant Hackett has been arrested on the Gold Coast, according to a report from Channel Seven. 
The network revealed the swimmer had been detained, and included footage purporting to be of Hackett in a police vehicle. 
Hackett was seen resting his head on the seat of the car before he appeared to raise his cuffed hands to the window. #BREAKING Former Olympian Grant Hackett arrested by police on the Gold Coast. Details to come #7News pic.twitter.com/5l4KTbxmMg — 7 News Perth (@7NewsPerth) February 15, 2017 
His father Nev said the 36-year-old had been detained over “mental health issues” but refused to comment further, The Courier Mail reported. 
No other details were immediately available. Former Olympian Grant Hackett arrested by police on the Gold Coast and taken to Southport police watchhouse. Picture: Channel Seven Source: Channel 7 
Hackett, who won the Olympic 1500m freestyle gold medals in 2000 and 2004, made an unsuccessful comeback to the pool at last year’s Olympic Games trials. 
He was in trouble after the event when involved in an incident on the flight home. 
An “embarrassed” Grant Hackett has apologised for his behaviour on the domestic flight, during which he was alleged to have abused a fellow passenger. 
“I seriously and genuinely regret my poor behaviour,” he said in a statement. 
“I have stuffed up more than once and am working on these issues. 
“It is embarrassing to hear and read the consequences of my actions. I apologise unreservedly to the gentleman on the flight. I am trying to make direct contact with him personally. 
“I know I have to front the media and discuss my actions in a more appropriate and accountable way. 
“I just have to sort a few things first so I can be as frank and open as I need to be. I apologise for the inconvenience.” Sign up for Sportsmail The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
